meanings.definition: Of or relating to the magnetosphere.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the magnetospheric effects on Earth's atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The magnetospheric disturbances can impact satellite communications.
meanings.sent3: The magnetospheric dance of charged particles creates a colorful light show.
meanings.sent4: Her magnetospheric personality drew people to her like a magnetic force.
meanings.sent5: The magnetospheric shield protects our planet from harmful solar radiation.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the magnetic field surrounding a celestial body.
meanings.sent1: The magnetospheric field around Jupiter is vast and powerful.
meanings.sent2: Auroras are caused by interactions in the magnetospheric environment.
meanings.sent3: The magnetospheric pull of the moon affects the tides on Earth.
meanings.sent4: His magnetospheric charm seemed to attract good luck wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The magnetospheric forces at play in the universe are truly fascinating.

meanings.definition: Characterized by the presence of a magnetosphere.
meanings.sent1: The magnetospheric planets in our solar system have unique properties.
meanings.sent2: Spacecraft must navigate through magnetospheric regions carefully.
meanings.sent3: The magnetospheric nature of the planet made it a popular destination for researchers.
meanings.sent4: Living in a magnetospheric environment requires special adaptations.
meanings.sent5: The magnetospheric conditions on Mars differ from those on Earth.
